Author: adi_onysus
Content: Got a few days left till the interview, whatchu all up to

Author: candyflipping.
Content: Good luck lad, I failed at the intervew test like 2 years ago, you should be ready to answer whats ur plan, why u took that specific course, etc etc. try to have an interview with somebody so you werent like that nervous when the interview begin

Author: adi_onysus
Content: Oh damn, did you have an LoA at the time or you went through the exam first?

Author: candyflipping.
Content:
No I don't, I should have had that earlier but yeah I dont have any preparation at all tbh, my friend was a first timer and he got into a uni at au also he had LoA before applying to LPDP, I forgot which uni but he also had an LoA from Manchester UK too

Do you have any LoA tho?

Author: candyflipping.
Content: Please give me an update til you finished all the process and I wish you the very best brother

Author: adi_onysus
Content: Yes, I have an LoA with me so I didn‚Äôt have to go through the exam

Author: adi_onysus
Content: Right now I‚Äôm just trying to memorize the things I wrote during the administration phase, and trying to understand what sort of awardee LPDP wants

Author: candyflipping.
Content: Oh yes I forgot to answer that I did the exam and I passed but I failed at interview, kinda sad but and I think you should be good if you have an LoA though

Author: adi_onysus
Content: I asked an interviewer about it a few months back, he told me his son had loads of LoA with him, but he didn't pass the interview

Author: adi_onysus
Content: The psychologist believed he lacked the conviction of coming back

Author: candyflipping.
Content: Yes you need to convince them why you took the course, how you gonna implement your course with what you believe and what you gonna do after uni etc etc

Author: istirahato
Content: Become a patriot when answering the question regarding the *return plan*

Author: istirahato
Content: Also, stay low profile and try not exaggerating things

Author: candyflipping.
Content: This is true

Author: adi_onysus
Content: Oh alright, let's say that my return plans are divided into short term and long term, and my long term goals are to contribute in both clinical and academic fields; as a clinical dietitian at a hospital, while also becoming a lecturer of dietetics, since at the moment dietitians are an uncommon profession in the health sector, and the dietetics program requires dietitians with a master's degree, or PhD degree to teach

Author: shiawase6946
Content:
Adding data might help. For example, for your claim on dietitians are uncommon. You can give obvious ones like how many clinical dietitians are there in Malang/Jatim versus how many people live there or versus how many people visit hospital you were having internship in.

Our  bureaucrats love numbers as if they are rocket science.

Author: istirahato
Content: ~~you could go wild with *mendukung program kerja pemerintah MBG*~~

Author: istirahato
Content: Careful though, sometimes the interviewer is not bureaucrats but the real academician

Author: adi_onysus
Content: I‚Äôll most likely be interviewed by doctors and health academics

Author: candyflipping.
Content: For me, there were three people in the interview session: an academic, a psychologist, and another person who I believe was also an academic, but from the LPDP side.

Author: adi_onysus
Content: Yeah, always have been like that, two academics and one psychologist

Author: adi_onysus
Content: The psychologist could be a hard egg to crack tho

Author: istirahato
Content: The academician from LPDP usually asking *spicy questions*

Author: adi_onysus
Content: What spicy questions are usually asked

Author: istirahato
Content: sometimes they ask personal things like *Gimana kalau dapet jodoh disana?* atau bahas soal perbedaan *salary* yang signifikan (kalau misal bukan ASN) terus menggiring ke mempertanyakan komitmen

Author: istirahato
Content: nevertheless, the experience about interview may differ between person, some people got easy-to-convince interviewer, some people got *pain in the ass HR-like* interviewer
